messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] L&L bursary query
messages.msgSnippet: ... From: Jodi Bezzola  Can someone in the know (Kelly?) tell me about conference bursaries? Are they for Canadians too??  We re doing
messages.messageBody:
-----Original Message-----
From: Jodi Bezzola <jodibezzola@...>

Can someone in the know (Kelly?) tell me about conference bursaries?
Are they
for Canadians too?? We're doing some talking about budget the last few
days and
are trying to be creative about perhaps making it to the
conference...thanks :)

-=-=-

CoolCool!

I'm going to ask you to join the LiveandLearnConference yahoogroup and
ask there. Pam Laricchia is coming from Toronto, and she would know
first-hand how that works and can tell you "in Canadian" (what it looks
like from a Canadian perspective).

I'm pretty sure you would just click on "US$" under payment and it
would convert, but....I'm not positive.

Pam is throwing her own Toronto conference party this weekend and may
be a bit slammed right now, so she might not respond right away. OH!
Gillian would know though! But she's not on this list either, I don't
think.

I'll send them both an email.

But join the conference list anyway! <g>

So cool!

-==-=-=-=-=-

Oh, and what about meals for kids under 5? I found all other prices
but that.
Are they free??

-=-=-=-=-

Meal plans for children under five are free. Lodging is too---if you
co-sleep, but it's snug!



~Kelly

Kelly Lovejoy
Conference Coordinator
Live and Learn Unschooling Conference
http://www.LiveandLearnConference.org

messages.subject: RE: [unschoolingbasics] risk-taking yesterday and tomorrow
messages.messageBody:
<<I'm on a high. Literally, I WAS high yesterday.

13,000 feet.>>



Thats amazing! Lots of guts and courage. It sounds like it was a
wonderful birthday celebration.

Namasté
be at peace,
Maisha
<http://khalfanifamilyadventures.blogspot.com/> Khalfani Family Adventures

When a big kid hits a little kid on the playground, we call him a bully;
five years later he punches a woman for her wallet and is called a mugger;
later still, when he slugs a fellow worker who insults him, he is called a
troublemaker, but when he becomes a father and hits his tiresome,
disobedient or disrespectful child, we call him a disciplinarian. Why is
this rung on a ladder of interpersonal violence regarded so differently from
the rest? ~ Penelope Leach
Don't be afraid of showing affection. Be warm and tender, thoughtful and
affectionate. Mankind is more helped by sympathy than by service. Love is
more than money, and a kind word will give more pleasure than a present.

~ Jean Baptiste Lacordaire

messages.subject: risk-taking yesterday and tomorrow
messages.msgSnippet: So...I ve been writing a lot these last two days.  I m on a high. Literally, I WAS high yesterday. 13,000 feet. And then I jumped out of a perfectly good
messages.messageBody:
So...I've been writing a lot these last two days. <BWG>

I'm on a high. Literally, I WAS high yesterday.

13,000 feet.

And then I jumped out of a perfectly good airplane!

Ben said last year that he wanted to sky-dive. Being the loving wife
that I am, that's what I gave him for his birthday: a tandem trip out
of an airplane.

Of course, Cameron wanted to go too, so we added him. Then his
girlfriend, Carly, HAD to jump too, so we added her. Duncan wanted to,
but, at 12, he's too young. I wanted to as well; but because Dunc
wouldn't jump for six more years, I agreed to wait and jump with him
then.

But when yesterday came, Dunc didn't want to get up so early and drive
all the way there just to watch, so he stayed home and slept late.

Everyone was geared up and waiting---and there was an empty spot. So I
took it!

It's a l-o-n-g way down from 13,000 feet!

Being the birthday boy, Ben got the video. The rest of us will just
have to settle with our memories. <G>

We'll ALL go again in six years with Duncan. <g>

As for Dunc: he's leaving tomorrow morning for Atlanta to fly up to
Boston *all by himself* to stay with friends for a week until we get
there for the North East Unschooling Conference. He's very excited (he
won't sleep tonight, I know!) and I'm sure a little frightened. But the
excitement's definitely winning out! <g>

So I took a big step yesterday, and Duncan's taking a big one tomorrow!

~Kelly

Kelly Lovejoy
Conference Coordinator
Live and Learn Unschooling Conference
http://www.LiveandLearnConference.org
